byline.contributor: Thomas Fuller contributed reporting from Bangkok.

abstract: Lee Kuan Yew, founding father of Singapore who transformed tiny island into one of wealthiest nations in Asia, dies at age 91; Lee became country's first prime minister in 1959, after it obtained full independence from Great Britain, and remained a driving cultural and political force long after stepping down in 1990; Lee's character is seen to have shaped qualities of his nation--efficient, incorrupt, forward-looking and pragmatic.
lead_paragraph: As prime minister for 31 years, Mr. Lee transformed the tiny island outpost into a modern, affluent city-state admired for its efficiency and low level of corruption.

headline.main: Lee Kuan Yew, Founding Father and First Premier of Singapore, Dies at 91
headline.print_headline: Lee Kuan Yew, Premier Who Pushed Singapore to Prosperity, Dies at 91

snippet: As prime minister for 31 years, Mr. Lee transformed the tiny island outpost into a modern, affluent city-state admired for its efficiency and low level of corruption.
